New York University Archives
Nite News RG.39.190
3.5 Linear Feet in one flat box, one manuscript box, and one reel of microfilm
1926-1931 This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Nite News dating from 1926 to 1931. The student newspaper was aimed at the Evening Session students at the Washington Square Campus and documented student life at NYU's Washington Square campus, athletics, local and national news, campus living, and student clubs. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Materials in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged chronologically.
Biographical / Historical
New York University has had many student newspapers since its founding. The University Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the University Heights campus was closed. The Washington Square campus held evening classes for students who worked during the day which had its own newspapers, the Nite News and the Evening News.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; the Nite News; RG 39.190; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues from the student newspaper the Nite News dating from 1926 to 1931. This newspaper documented student life at NYU's Washington Square campus, athletics, local and national news, campus living, and student clubs as related to the Evening Division of students. The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collections includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Researchers must consult microfilm copies due to the fragility of the original newspapers.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
College student newspapers and periodicals. Student activities.
